text:
Looking for visual generative art(ists) that are familiar with or interested in Christopher Alexander’s work. I’m toying with the idea of collaborating towards a series of artworks that manifest and demonstrate Alexander’s 15 geometric properties of wholeness in the digital space and which could later on perhaps serve as material for a practical studio course that teaches these properties in a way more accessible to computer people so that they don’t have to become architects first to learn them.

I tweeted a little thread about this as a beacon for interested people to find me and to start a discussion (and perhaps even collaboration?).

Would greatly appreciate if you helped spread the word to people you know who might be interested. :pray:

<https://twitter.com/stefanlesser/status/1322929366251327488?s=21|https://twitter.com/stefanlesser/status/1322929366251327488?s=21>

attachments.fallback: <https://twitter.com/stefanlesser|@stefanlesser>: As part of my Building Beauty studies (<https://www.buildingbeauty.org/building-beauty-online>) I’m reading Christopher Alexander’s The Nature of Order and learn about what makes buildings and art (and things in general) wholesome and beautiful.
attachments.text: As part of my Building Beauty studies (<https://www.buildingbeauty.org/building-beauty-online>) I’m reading Christopher Alexander’s The Nature of Order and learn about what makes buildings and art (and things in general) wholesome and beautiful.

elements.text: Looking for visual generative art(ists) that are familiar with or interested in Christopher Alexander’s work. I’m toying with the idea of collaborating towards a series of artworks that manifest and demonstrate Alexander’s 15 geometric properties of wholeness in the digital space and which could later on perhaps serve as material for a practical studio course that teaches these properties in a way more accessible to computer people so that they don’t have to become architects first to learn them.
I tweeted a little thread about this as a beacon for interested people to find me and to start a discussion (and perhaps even collaboration?).
Would greatly appreciate if you helped spread the word to people you know who might be interested.

text: I would be interested in following this adventure! I have just started exploring generative art and would love to experiment things along this line. I guess you are looking for artists with more experience, that may more or less already use the 15 geometric properties (even subconsciously), but I am really curious about this topic. And it will be a good way for me to enter the Alexander's world.

elements.text: I would be interested in following this adventure! I have just started exploring generative art and would love to experiment things along this line. I guess you are looking for artists with more experience, that may more or less already use the 15 geometric properties (even subconsciously), but I am really curious about this topic. And it will be a good way for me to enter the Alexander's world.

text: And to get in touch to more artists, maybe you could try a post on Instagram, I guess they are more present there.

elements.text: And to get in touch to more artists, maybe you could try a post on Instagram, I guess they are more present there.

text: Oh my wow.  Such a well realized prototype.  I'll take all of this please.  "ACM SIGCHI 2016" — please tell me this line of inquiry didn't just die?!

elements.text: Oh my wow.  Such a well realized prototype.  I'll take all of this please.  "ACM SIGCHI 2016" — please tell me this line of inquiry didn't just die?!

text:
<@UJ6LDMMN0> No, I don’t care about experience, I only care about interest in exploring Alexander’s work. And the 15 properties are just an example that looks promising to me; there might very well be other connections to explore. 

I’m not aware of anybody having done this before, and there is some thoughtful exploration needed to figure out if and how the 15 properties can map to digital art, but I don’t see any reasons why they shouldn’t.

elements.text:
No, I don’t care about experience, I only care about interest in exploring Alexander’s work. And the 15 properties are just an example that looks promising to me; there might very well be other connections to explore. 

I’m not aware of anybody having done this before, and there is some thoughtful exploration needed to figure out if and how the 15 properties can map to digital art, but I don’t see any reasons why they shouldn’t.
